result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st) (PAC<0.15) and Cause Injury while Operating with PAC (1st) (PAC<0.15). The defendant was found guilty of Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st) (PAC<0.15) and the other charge, Cause Injury while Operating with PAC (1st) (PAC<0.15) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jeffrey S Gordon was found guilty of Hit and Run-Involve Injury, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Jeffrey S Gordon was found guilty of Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st) (PAC<0.15), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution is ordered in the amount of $77,471.51. Restitution to the victim in the amount of $81.86 has been paid in full and disbursed to the victim through the Clerk of Courts Office. The remaining balance is subject to the Defendant's right to challenge through a restitution hearing.
--------------------------
**AMENDMENT 04-01-2015 - PURSUANT TO RESTITUTION HEARING HELD ON 03-25-2015 AND BY ORDER OF THE COURT, Restitution to Blue Cross Blue Shield/Blue Plus of Minnesota and Liberty Mutual Insurance is set at "0".
--------------------------

No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No prescription medications without a valid prescription. 
--------------------------

Must attend a Victim Impact Panel.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. Any prescriptions must be made known to the Agent and taken as prescribed.
--------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
--------------------------

Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
--------------------------
**3rd AMENDMENT - Bond money  from the Defendant in the amount of $409.95 has been applied toward the Defendant's outstanding Court obligations. 
--------------------------

supervisions.notes: AMENDED Pursuant to request from Department of Corrections and by Order of the Court defendant's term of probation is amended to  maximum of 2 years.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $300.00 fine plus costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
--------------------------

Pursuant to sec. 973.046(1r), the defendant is required to pay $200.00 DNA surcharge.
--------------------------

timeConds.notes: to commence forthwith. The defendant is to serve the first sixty (60) days with NO work release privileges. The remaining conditional release jail time to be served with work release privileges.
